get.summary: Returns all companies and its external metadata mappings.

get.summary: Checks if the service is healthy

200.description: Service is healthy

get.summary: Identify a game by its file hashes or filename and size, returning the matched metadata ids, goes in order sha256, sha1, md5 and filename + size (from most accurate to least accurate)

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The file name of the game file.

parameters.name: fileSize
parameters.description: The size of the game file in bytes.

parameters.name: md5
parameters.description: Optional MD5 hash of the game file.

parameters.name: sha1
parameters.description: Optional SHA1 hash of the game file.

parameters.name: sha256
parameters.description: Optional SHA256 hash of the game file.

200.description: Returns info about a possible match via hashes or filename and size

get.summary: Checks if the service is ready

200.description: Service is Ready

AutomaticMatchReason.description: Reason why a game was automatically matched.

CompanyResponse.description: Response for a company including external metadata.

providerId.description: The ID of the game for this provider.

FailedMatchReason.description: Reason why an automatic match failed.

externalMetadata.description: External metadata for the matched game.

id.description: If a match was found, the ID of the matched game.

GameMatchType.description: Type of match for this game.

ManualMatchMode.description: How a game was manually matched.

PlatformResponse.description: Response for a platform including external metadata.

companyId.description: Optional ID of the company that made the platform.

companyName.description: Optional name of the company that made the platform.
